camel.sink.path.host.name: camel.sink.path.host
camel.sink.path.host.description: The host that the consumer should bind to or the host of the remote websocket destination that the producer should connect to

camel.sink.path.port.name: camel.sink.path.port
camel.sink.path.port.description: The port that the consumer should bind to or port of the remote websocket destination that the producer should connect to

camel.sink.path.path.name: camel.sink.path.path
camel.sink.path.path.description: The path that the consumer should bind to or path of the remote websocket destination that the producer should connect to

camel.sink.endpoint.clientOptions.name: camel.sink.endpoint.clientOptions
camel.sink.endpoint.clientOptions.description: Sets customized options for configuring the WebSocket client used in the producer

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.sendToAll.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sendToAll
camel.sink.endpoint.sendToAll.description: To send to all websocket subscribers. Can be used to configure on endpoint level, instead of having to use the VertxWebsocketConstants.SEND_TO_ALL header on the message.

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.vertx-websocket.lazyStar.name: camel.component.vertx-websocket.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.vertx-websocket.lazyStar.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.vertx-websocket.basicPro.name: camel.component.vertx-websocket.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.vertx-websocket.basicPro.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.vertx-websocket.vertx.name: camel.component.vertx-websocket.vertx
camel.component.vertx-websocket.vertx.description: To use an existing vertx instead of creating a new instance

camel.component.vertx-websocket.vertxOpt.name: camel.component.vertx-websocket.vertxOptions
camel.component.vertx-websocket.vertxOpt.description: To provide a custom set of vertx options for configuring vertx

camel.component.vertx-websocket.useGloba.name: camel.component.vertx-websocket.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.vertx-websocket.useGloba.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
